info.title: Madaster Private API - Build: 8814
info.description:
Welcome to the **Madaster Private API** endpoint. This endpoint can be used to interact with the Madaster Platform and its resources. This API does not fully cover all functionality of the platform yet, please see below for the available functions and what they can be used for. For detailed information about the platform and this API, please refer to the [Madaster Documentation](https://docs.madaster.com) or the [Madaster API Documentation](https://docs.madaster.com/api).

To access these resources, you need an authorization token. If you do not have one yet, see the chapter about Authorization in the [API documentation](https://docs.madaster.com/api). This token should be sent as a header with the name 'X-API-Key', which will authenticate the request with the token. The documentation below specifies which requests are available and which responses they might produce.

This API can be reached at the endpoint: **[https://api.madaster.com/](https://api.madaster.com/)**

get.summary: Gets the current account for the token

200.description: The account for the used token.

get.summary: Gets the foldertypes for the account

200.description: The foldertypes for the account.

get.summary: Gets all buildings

200.description: The request was successful and will return all buildings.

201.description: The building was created and the location of the resource will be returned in the 'location' header.

get.summary: Gets a building by its identifier

200.description: The request was successful and will return the building.
The building was replaced in its entirety and the result will be returned.

delete.summary: Deletes the building and all related data

get.summary: Gets building validation parameters

200.description: The building validation paramaters for the active source files.

get.summary: Gets the circular information of a building

200.description: The request was successful and will return the building's circular information.

post.summary: Schedules the building for proccesing, recalculates all data

202.description: The processing was accepted for generation

post.summary: Schedules the generation of a PDF building passport

parameters.name: accept-language
parameters.description: The culture to use for the request

202.description: The pdf passport was accepted for generation

post.summary: Schedules the generation of a Excel building passport

parameters.name: accept-language
parameters.description: The culture to use for the request

202.description: The excel passport was accepted for generation

get.summary: Gets all building files

200.description: The request was successful and will return all building files.

201.description: The building file was created and the location of the resource will be returned in the 'location' header.

get.summary: Gets a building file by its identifier

200.description: The request was successful and will return the building file.

get.summary: Gets a building file status by its identifier

200.description: The request was successful and will return the building file status.

get.summary: Gets a download url for the building file

200.description: The request was successful and will return the download url.

post.summary: Activates or deactivates a building file

200.description: The active-status of the building file was updated and the building file will be returned.

post.summary: Sets the status of a file to 'importing', so element can be added or updated can be made.

204.description: The building file was set to 'importing', no content will be returned.

post.summary: Starts the refinement of a building file.

202.description: The refinement of the building file was started and the location to fetch it's status can be found in the header.

201.description: The building file was successfully uploaded, and scheduled for further processing.

202.description: The building file was successfully uploaded.

get.summary: Gets a building file's elements
get.description:
This API is ODATA enabled, the following filters can be used:

* $select
* $filter
* $skip
* $top
            
[READ MORE](https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/graph/docs/concepts/query_parameters)

200.description: The request was successful and will return the building file element.

post.summary: Create a new building file element

201.description: The building file element was created and the location of the resource will be returned in the 'location' header.

get.summary: Gets a building file element

200.description: The request was successful and will return the building file element.

put.summary: Updated an existing building file element

200.description: The building file element was replaced in its entirety and the result will be returned.

delete.summary: Deletes an existing building file element

204.description: The building file element was successfully deleted.

post.summary: Batch: upsert (insert or update) multiple new building file elements (max 500)

200.description: The building file elements are created or updated.

get.summary: Gets all material databases

parameters.description: The culture to use for the request

200.description: The available databases for the specified token.

get.summary: Get a material databases

parameters.name: accept-language
parameters.description: The culture to use for the request

200.description: The material database.

202.description: The account for the used token.

get.summary: Gets all folders

200.description: The available folders for the account.

201.description: The folder was created and the location of the resource will be returned in the 'location' header.

get.summary: Gets a portfolio by its identifier

200.description: The request was successful and will return the folder.
The folder was replaced in its entirety and the result will be returned.

get.summary: Gets all materials from a database

200.description: All materials in the database

get.summary: Gets a material by id

The material was replaced in its entirety and the result will be returned.

The product was replaced in its entirety and the result will be returned.

200.description: The request was successful and will return the product's children.

200.description: The child was added and will be returned.

200.description: The child was updated and will be returned.

delete.summary: Deleted a child from a product.
